concise_definition: n. 沙漠; v. 遗弃, 逃离

definitions.explanation_en: A large, dry, barren area of land, typically with little or no vegetation and extreme temperatures, often covered in sand or rock.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一片广阔、干燥、荒芜的土地，通常植被稀少或完全没有，气温极端，常被沙子或岩石覆盖。
definitions.example_en: The Sahara is the largest hot desert in the world.
definitions.example_cn: 撒哈拉是世界上最大的热带沙漠。

definitions.explanation_en: To abandon someone or something, especially when you have a duty or responsibility to stay.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在有责任或义务留下时，却故意抛弃某人或某物。
definitions.example_en: He deserted his post during the battle and was court-martialed.
definitions.example_cn: 他在战斗中擅离职守，被军事法庭审判。

definitions.explanation_en: To leave a place, organization, or group, often suddenly and without intention to return.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指突然离开某个地方、组织或团体，且无意返回。
definitions.example_en: Several members deserted the party after the scandal broke.
definitions.example_cn: 丑闻曝光后，数名成员退出了该政党。

comparison.analysis: “Abandon” (遗弃) 语气更强烈，常暗示彻底、无情地丢弃，带有道德谴责意味，适用于人、财产、计划等。而 “desert” 更强调违背责任或义务的逃离，尤其用于军事、岗位或团体情境，带有背叛的色彩。
“Forsake” (舍弃) 更具文学性或情感色彩，常用于情感关系或信仰上的断绝，如“forsake one’s family”或“forsake one’s faith”。它比 “desert” 更内省、更沉重，而 “desert” 更侧重行为上的离开。
“Arid” (干燥的) 是形容词，仅描述气候或土地缺乏水分的状态，不涉及行为或人。而 “desert” 作为名词时指具体的地理区域，作为动词时则指人的主动行为，二者词性和语义范畴完全不同。
